subject: RE: [junit] written recommendation of super.setUp/tearDown ?
msgSnippet: ... Yup, it s the best way, but it s unfortunate that JUnit forces you to do that, because having to call super is a clear design smell in OO design (because
messageBody:
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of Russell Gold

> On 7/26/05, Dave Brosius <dbrosius@...> wrote:
> > I have it in my head that the junit folks recommend always calling
> > super.setUp/tearDown from a user declared setUp/tearDown,
> even if the
> > JUnit test in question is directly derived from TestCase. However i
> > cannot find any written (web page) recommendation to so. Is
> this still
> > the case? Is there a documented recommendation some where?
>
> Even if you cannot find the page, this is definitely a good
> idea. If you decide at a later time to have your test case
> extend something besides TestCase, your invocations of
> super.setUp/tearDown will already be in place.

Yup, it's the best way, but it's unfortunate that JUnit forces you to do
that, because having to call super is a clear design smell in OO design
(because if somebody subclasses your class and forget to call super, it will
break). In short, it defeats the purpose of polymorphism.

--
